clusters.title: Brazil floods and landslides kill at least 30 after record rainfall
clusters.neutral_headline: Brazil Floods Kill At Least 30 People

items.title: Brazil floods and landslides kill at least 30 after record rainfall
items.standfirst: Three firefighters recovered a man’s body from mud and rubble after landslides triggered by torrential rains killed 30 people in southeastern Brazil, authorities said Tuesday, with 39 still missing. Rivers burst their banks in Minas Gerais state, inundating Juiz de Fora and Uba. More than 200 people were rescued.
items.content: Three firefighters recovered a man’s body from mud and rubble after landslides triggered by torrential rains killed 30 people in southeastern Brazil, authorities said Tuesday, with 39 still missing. Rivers burst their banks in Minas Gerais state, inundating Juiz de Fora and Uba. More than 200 people were rescued.

items.title: Floods and landslides in Brazil kill at least 30 after record rainfall
items.standfirst: Firefighters search for 39 people missing in debris after river burst and houses were swept awayThree firefighters pulled a man’s body from the mud amid the rubble of houses swept away in a landslide in south-eastern Brazil, where 30 people died and 39 were still missing on Tuesday after torrential rains.A river in the state of Minas Gerais burst its banks and streets became raging currents of brown water after an overnight downpour in a region that has seen record rain this month. Continue reading...
items.content: Firefighters search for 39 people missing in debris after river burst and houses were swept awayThree firefighters pulled a man’s body from the mud amid the rubble of houses swept away in a landslide in south-eastern Brazil, where 30 people died and 39 were still missing on Tuesday after torrential rains.A river in the state of Minas Gerais burst its banks and streets became raging currents of brown water after an overnight downpour in a region that has seen record rain this month. Continue reading...

items.title: Floods and landslides in Brazil kill at least 25
items.standfirst: Hundreds of people have been displaced and dozens are missing, with rescue operations still ongoing in Juiz de Fora.
items.content: Hundreds of people have been displaced and dozens are missing, with rescue operations still ongoing in Juiz de Fora.

items.title: At least 23 dead as heavy rains unleash floods in southeastern Brazil
items.standfirst: Search and rescue workers are looking for more than 40 people who remain missing as towns reel from torrential rainfall.
items.content: Search and rescue workers are looking for more than 40 people who remain missing as towns reel from torrential rainfall.

ai_summary: Floods and landslides kill 30 people in Brazil
39 people still missing after torrential rains
Rivers burst banks in Minas Gerais state
Over 200 people rescued from flooded areas
Search and rescue operations ongoing

clusters.title: Paris says US envoy pledges not to 'interfere' in France affairs
clusters.neutral_headline: US Ambassador To France Pledges Not To Interfere

items.title: Paris says US envoy pledges not to 'interfere' in France affairs
items.standfirst: The US ambassador to Paris, Charles Kushner, called France's foreign minister Tuesday and pledged not to "interfere" in the host country's affairs, a diplomatic source said, after a fallout over Washington's remarks following the killing of a far-right activist. FRANCE 24's August Hakansson reports.
items.content: The US ambassador to Paris, Charles Kushner, called France's foreign minister Tuesday and pledged not to "interfere" in the host country's affairs, a diplomatic source said, after a fallout over Washington's remarks following the killing of a far-right activist. FRANCE 24's August Hakansson reports.

items.title: From prison to Paris: Ambassador Charles Kushner at the centre of a Franco-American rift
items.standfirst: US Ambassador to France Charles Kushner – a former felon and real-estate magnate aligned with US President Donald Trump – is at the centre of a diplomatic spat after failing to obey a foreign ministry summons, prompting France to restrict his access to government officials. Pardoned by Donald Trump in 2020, Kushner’s appointment has long drawn scrutiny for his criminal past and lack of diplomatic experience.
items.content: US Ambassador to France Charles Kushner – a former felon and real-estate magnate aligned with US President Donald Trump – is at the centre of a diplomatic spat after failing to obey a foreign ministry summons, prompting France to restrict his access to government officials. Pardoned by Donald Trump in 2020, Kushner’s appointment has long drawn scrutiny for his criminal past and lack of diplomatic experience.

items.title: US ambassador to France set for talks with foreign minister after row
items.standfirst: Charles Kushner has spoken to France's foreign minister after failing to respond to a summons on Monday.
items.content: Charles Kushner has spoken to France's foreign minister after failing to respond to a summons on Monday.

items.title: Kushner calls Barrot after fallout
items.standfirst: According to sources, the US envoy pledges not to 'interfere' in France affairs. François Picard speaks to Jeffrey Hawkins, former US ambassador to the Central African Republic and research fellow at IRIS.
items.content: According to sources, the US envoy pledges not to 'interfere' in France affairs. François Picard speaks to Jeffrey Hawkins, former US ambassador to the Central African Republic and research fellow at IRIS.

items.title: US ambassador to France vows not to interfere in its domestic affairs
items.standfirst: Charles Kushner, father of president’s son-in-law Jared, failed to show up to meeting to explain US comments relating to death of far-right activistDonald Trump’s envoy to Paris has called France’s foreign minister and pledged not to interfere in the country’s domestic affairs, a day after he was barred from talking to government officials for failing to attend a formal meeting at the ministry.The foreign ministry said on Monday that Charles Kushner would not be permitted to carry out his diplomatic duties until he had explained his refusal to comply with the summons over US comments about the killing of a far-right activist in France. Continue reading...
items.content: Charles Kushner, father of president’s son-in-law Jared, failed to show up to meeting to explain US comments relating to death of far-right activistDonald Trump’s envoy to Paris has called France’s foreign minister and pledged not to interfere in the country’s domestic affairs, a day after he was barred from talking to government officials for failing to attend a formal meeting at the ministry.The foreign ministry said on Monday that Charles Kushner would not be permitted to carry out his diplomatic duties until he had explained his refusal to comply with the summons over US comments about the killing of a far-right activist in France. Continue reading...

items.title: France demands U.S. Ambassador Charles Kushner explain no-show as Trump's diplomats anger Europe
items.standfirst: U.S. Ambassador Charles Kushner has been banned from meeting French officials after snubbing a meeting over comments about the death of far-right activist Quentin Deranque.
items.content: U.S. Ambassador Charles Kushner has been banned from meeting French officials after snubbing a meeting over comments about the death of far-right activist Quentin Deranque.

clusters.title: The Louvre Museum's director has resigned in the wake of October's brazen jewel heist

items.title: The Louvre Museum's director has resigned in the wake of October's brazen jewel heist
items.standfirst: French President Emmanuel Macron accepted Laurence des Cars' resignation as "an act of responsibility" at a moment when the Louvre needs security upgrades, modernization and other major projects.
items.content: French President Emmanuel Macron accepted Laurence des Cars' resignation as "an act of responsibility" at a moment when the Louvre needs security upgrades, modernization and other major projects.(Image credit: Emma Da Silva)

items.title: Louvre president resigns as jewellery heist inquiry reveals ‘systemic failures’
items.standfirst: Laurence des Cars steps down days after parliamentary inquiry called Paris museum a ‘state within a state’The president of the Louvre in Paris has resigned, four months after a gang of thieves broke into the museum’s Apollo gallery and made off with €88m (£76m) of Napoleonic jewellery in France’s most dramatic heist in decades.Laurence des Cars, who had offered to step down in the immediate aftermath of the burglary, tendered her resignation to Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday in what the French president called “an act of responsibility”, the Elysée Palace said. Continue reading...
items.content: Laurence des Cars steps down days after parliamentary inquiry called Paris museum a ‘state within a state’The president of the Louvre in Paris has resigned, four months after a gang of thieves broke into the museum’s Apollo gallery and made off with €88m (£76m) of Napoleonic jewellery in France’s most dramatic heist in decades.Laurence des Cars, who had offered to step down in the immediate aftermath of the burglary, tendered her resignation to Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday in what the French president called “an act of responsibility”, the Elysée Palace said. Continue reading...

items.title: Louvre director resigns after a series of high-profile setbacks for the museum
items.standfirst: Louvre museum director Laurence des Cars resigned on Tuesday after a series of setbacks for the world-renowned museum. A high-profile jewel heist in October raised questions about security lapses while labour strikes and reports that the building is falling into disrepair have led to calls for an overhaul of the famous landmark.
items.content: Louvre museum director Laurence des Cars resigned on Tuesday after a series of setbacks for the world-renowned museum. A high-profile jewel heist in October raised questions about security lapses while labour strikes and reports that the building is falling into disrepair have led to calls for an overhaul of the famous landmark.

ai_summary: Louvre museum director Laurence des Cars resigns
Resignation due to security lapses and jewel heist
French President Emmanuel Macron accepts resignation
Labour strikes and disrepair also affected museum
Parliamentary inquiry revealed systemic failures

items.title: Democrats refuse to stand for Trump as Al Green ejected over ‘apes’ protest sign
items.standfirst: Texas Democrat removed for holding ‘Black people aren’t apes’ sign as colleagues stay seated while Republicans cheerAs dozens of their colleagues boycotted Trump’s State of the Union address, several of the Democrats in the House chamber on Tuesday night made their opposition to the president’s remarks clear.Congressman Al Green was ejected from the speech almost immediately, marking the second year in a row he has been removed from the annual event. After being ordered out by House speaker Mike Johnson during last year’s speech for yelling responses as the president spoke, this year’s protest from the Texas representative was silent but pointed. Continue reading...
items.content: Texas Democrat removed for holding ‘Black people aren’t apes’ sign as colleagues stay seated while Republicans cheerAs dozens of their colleagues boycotted Trump’s State of the Union address, several of the Democrats in the House chamber on Tuesday night made their opposition to the president’s remarks clear.Congressman Al Green was ejected from the speech almost immediately, marking the second year in a row he has been removed from the annual event. After being ordered out by House speaker Mike Johnson during last year’s speech for yelling responses as the president spoke, this year’s protest from the Texas representative was silent but pointed. items.title: Trump defends first-year record in State of the Union speech amid low approval ratings
items.standfirst: President brings in US men’s hockey team as surprise guests to bolster speech before November midtermsState of the Union address - live updatesSign up for the Breaking News US email to get newsletter alerts in your inboxDonald Trump proclaimed his first year in office a success at the State of the Union address on Tuesday evening, even as his presidency is dogged by low public approval ratings before November’s midterm elections in which voters could hand control of Congress back to his Democratic opponents.The annual address to a joint session of Congress came after months of turmoil for the Republican president, including a crackdown on immigrant communities in Minneapolis that resulted in the deaths of two US citizens, and faltering progress on his campaign promise of lowering the cost of living. Continue reading...
items.content: President brings in US men’s hockey team as surprise guests to bolster speech before November midtermsState of the Union address - live updatesSign up for the Breaking News US email to get newsletter alerts in your inboxDonald Trump proclaimed his first year in office a success at the State of the Union address on Tuesday evening, even as his presidency is dogged by low public approval ratings before November’s midterm elections in which voters could hand control of Congress back to his Democratic opponents.The annual address to a joint session of Congress came after months of turmoil for the Republican president, including a crackdown on immigrant communities in Minneapolis that resulted in the deaths of two US citizens, and faltering progress on his campaign promise of lowering the cost of living. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump boasts 'turnaround for the ages' in State of the Union address
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump boasted Tuesday of a "turnaround for the ages" in a State of the Union speech, seeking to reverse his dismal polls and see off mounting challenges at home and abroad ahead of crucial midterm elections. Arriving to address a joint session of Congress, Trump was welcomed with cheers and a standing ovation from Republicans while Democrats remained seated in protest. Follow our liveblog for the latest updates.
items.content: US President Donald Trump boasted Tuesday of a "turnaround for the ages" in a State of the Union speech, seeking to reverse his dismal polls and see off mounting challenges at home and abroad ahead of crucial midterm elections. Arriving to address a joint session of Congress, Trump was welcomed with cheers and a standing ovation from Republicans while Democrats remained seated in protest. Follow our liveblog for the latest updates.

ai_summary: Trump delivers longest State of the Union address
Democrats refuse to stand for Trump's speech
Al Green ejected for holding protest sign
Trump defends his first-year record and policies
Democrats hold counter-events during speech

items.title: Iran says deal with US 'within reach' ahead of talks in Geneva
items.standfirst: Iran’s Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi said Tuesday a deal to avert military confrontation with the United States was within reach, ahead of talks set to resume in Geneva. His remarks came as Tehran issued a muted warning to student protesters amid mounting US threats over Iran’s nuclear programme.

clusters.title: 'Historical moment' as Bodo/Glimt succeed against all odds

items.title: 'Historical moment' as Bodo/Glimt succeed against all odds
items.standfirst: Bodo/Glimt knock out last year's finalists Inter Milan in one of the biggest upsets in Champions League history and now the team from the Arctic Circle is dreaming of how far they can go after reaching last 16.
items.content: Bodo/Glimt knock out last year's finalists Inter Milan in one of the biggest upsets in Champions League history and now the team from the Arctic Circle is dreaming of how far they can go after reaching last 16.

items.title: Bodo/Glimt complete dream run with victory over Inter Milan in Champions League
items.standfirst: Norwegian side Bodo/Glimt reached the Champions League last 16 on Tuesday after a 2-1 win at Inter Milan secured a 5-2 aggregate victory, sealing the biggest result in the club’s history and setting up a tie with either Manchester City or Sporting Portugal.
items.content: Norwegian side Bodo/Glimt reached the Champions League last 16 on Tuesday after a 2-1 win at Inter Milan secured a 5-2 aggregate victory, sealing the biggest result in the club’s history and setting up a tie with either Manchester City or Sporting Portugal.

clusters.title: Assisted dying on Welsh NHS a step closer as Senedd votes in favour
clusters.neutral_headline: Wales Moves Closer To Assisted Dying Law

items.title: Assisted dying on Welsh NHS a step closer as Senedd votes in favour
items.standfirst: In major vote Senedd backs legislation which could allow for terminally ill people to end their lives.
items.content: In major vote Senedd backs legislation which could allow for terminally ill people to end their lives.

items.title: Senedd votes in favour of implementing Westminster’s assisted dying bill
items.standfirst: Should legislation pass House of Lords, the matter will require another vote after May’s Welsh electionsWales’s Senedd has voted in favour of implementing Westminster’s assisted dying bill, overcoming a constitutionally awkward situation that could have forced terminally ill people who wish to end their lives to travel to England or seek private provision.In a debate stretching into Tuesday night in the Senedd’s newly expanded chamber, members voted 28 for and 23 against, with two abstentions. Should the legislation pass the House of Lords, the matter will require another Senedd vote after May’s Welsh elections. Continue reading...
items.content: Should legislation pass House of Lords, the matter will require another vote after May’s Welsh electionsWales’s Senedd has voted in favour of implementing Westminster’s assisted dying bill, overcoming a constitutionally awkward situation that could have forced terminally ill people who wish to end their lives to travel to England or seek private provision.In a debate stretching into Tuesday night in the Senedd’s newly expanded chamber, members voted 28 for and 23 against, with two abstentions. Should the legislation pass the House of Lords, the matter will require another Senedd vote after May’s Welsh elections. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Wales moves closer to assisted dying law
Senedd votes in favor of legislation
Terminally ill people may be able to end lives
Legislation requires another vote after elections
Constitutionally awkward situation resolved

clusters.title: South Africa secures release of more nationals lured to Ukraine war
clusters.neutral_headline: South Africa Secures Release Of Nationals

items.title: South Africa secures release of more nationals lured to Ukraine war
items.standfirst: In tonight's edition, President Cyril Ramaphosa thanks his counterpart Vladimir Putin for helping to secure the return of 11 South Africans tricked into joining the Russia-Ukraine war. Also, the military spokesperson for the M23 rebel group is reportedly killed in an army drone strike in eastern DR Congo. And more than 6 million people are on the brink of famine in Somalia as the country is facing widespread drought.
items.content: In tonight's edition, President Cyril Ramaphosa thanks his counterpart Vladimir Putin for helping to secure the return of 11 South Africans tricked into joining the Russia-Ukraine war. Also, the military spokesperson for the M23 rebel group is reportedly killed in an army drone strike in eastern DR Congo. And more than 6 million people are on the brink of famine in Somalia as the country is facing widespread drought.

items.title: Ramaphosa thanks Putin for release of South Africans lured into Russia-Ukraine war
items.standfirst: The men believed they were going to Russia for training as bodyguards but ended up on the front line.
